qas.question: Why was the 360 considered a market success for Microsoft?

answers.text: it strengthened Microsoft as a major force in the console market

qas.question: What problem hurt Nintendo's Wii console?

answers.text: collapse of third-party software support in its later years

qas.question: The Playstation 3 originally struggled for market share for what reasons?

answers.text: due to being too expensive and initially lacking quality titles

qas.question: What is the successor to the 360 called?
Which console sold the most units in the seventh generation era?
What was the best selling console of the sixth gen?
What feature of the Xbox 360 collapsed?

plausible_answers.text: too expensive and initially lacking quality titles

qas.question: What features caused Wii U to struggle?
What PlayStation put pressure on the Xbox One?

context: The <b5_0>Xbox 360<b5_0/> sold much better than its predecessor, and although not the best-selling console of the seventh-generation, it is regarded as a success since <a0_0>it strengthened Microsoft as a major force in the console market<a0_0/> at the expense of well-established rivals. The inexpensive <a4_0>Nintendo Wii<a4_0/> did sell the most console units but eventually saw a <a1_0>collapse of <b6_0>third-party software support<b6_0/> in its later years<a1_0/>, and it has been viewed by some as a fad since the succeeding Wii U had a poor debut in <b7_0>2012<b7_0/>. The PlayStation 3 struggled for a time <a2_0>due to being <b8_0>too expensive and initially lacking quality titles<b8_0/><a2_0/>, making it far less dominant than its predecessor, the PlayStation 2, and it took until late in the <b9_0>PlayStation 3<b9_0/>'s lifespan for its sales and game titles to reach parity with the Xbox 360. TechRadar proclaimed that "Xbox 360 passes the baton as the king of the hill – a position that puts all the more pressure on its successor, <a3_0>Xbox One<a3_0/>".
